creator: fteti@zefer.com
text:
> Trying to run Apache SOAP, keep getting this error. 
> 
>  
> [Loaded java.net.SocketOptions from C:\Program 
> Files\JavaSoft\JRE\1.2\lib\rt.jar 
> ] 
> [Loaded java.net.Socket$2 from C:\Program 
> Files\JavaSoft\JRE\1.2\lib\rt.jar] 
> [Loaded java.net.SocketOutputStream from C:\Program 
> Files\JavaSoft\JRE\1.2\lib\r 
> t.jar] 
> [Loaded java.net.Socket$1 from C:\Program 
> Files\JavaSoft\JRE\1.2\lib\rt.jar] 
> [Loaded java.net.SocketInputStream from C:\Program 
> Files\JavaSoft\JRE\1.2\lib\rt 
> .jar] 
> [Loaded sun.io.CharToByteISO8859_1 from C:\Program 
> Files\JavaSoft\JRE\1.2\lib\rt 
> .jar] 
> [Loaded javax.mail.internet.HeaderTokenizer] 
> [Loaded javax.mail.internet.HeaderTokenizer$Token] 
> [Loaded sun.io.ByteToCharUTF8 from C:\Program 
> Files\JavaSoft\JRE\1.2\lib\rt.jar] 
> 
> [Loaded org.apache.soap.util.IOUtils] 
> [Loaded org.apache.xerces.framework.XMLDTDScanner] 
> [Loaded org.apache.soap.server.ServiceManager] 
> [Loaded org.apache.soap.util.ConfigManager] 
> Ouch, the call failed: 
>   Fault Code   = SOAP-ENV:Server.Exception: 
>   Fault String = org.w3c.dom.Node: method 
> getNamespaceURI()Ljava/lang/String; not found 
> [Loaded java.lang.ref.Finalizer$3 from C:\Program 
> Files\JavaSoft\JRE\1.2\lib\rt. 
>

creator: sandygao@ca.ibm.com
text:
Sounds like a classic classpath problem.
Make sure there is no other DOM implementation in front of xerces.jar in the 
classpath.
